channel.title: LOL @ my friend
channel.description:
just read this, it was a aruement about what mobo he should buy, and he wanted a crossfire mobo, but the one he chose dident suppport it, so i attemped to point him in the rite direction xD
TFK_Mickmoffat: hey shrogg: hi TFK_Mickmoffat: what you up to?? shrogg: just about to get food shrogg: :P TFK_Mickmoffat: kk TFK_Mickmoffat: should i get $169 mb or $200 ram or got a $200 mb and $169 ram?? TFK_Mickmoffat: get* shrogg: 169 ram shrogg: 200 mobo TFK_Mickmoffat: kk TFK_Mickmoffat: and why?? shrogg: better mobo = better addons shrogg: ram dosent have to be hard core shrogg: it just needs to work shrogg: where as a mobo is the thing that runs it all shrogg: so if you get a better mobo then later you can get better cpu or somthing similar TFK_Mickmoffat: this is what im getting http://www.playtech.co.nz/afawcs0139235/CATID=254/ID=6677/SID=1051025654/productdetails.html shrogg: good shrogg: you can just chuck a heatsinc on later if it ever gets hot shrogg: like the heatsinc of the ram in ur dads pc TFK_Mickmoffat: and the mb http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview.asp?partid=12653 TFK_Mickmoffat: haha the only diffrence is that that ram has no hetsink TFK_Mickmoffat: i got 205 in my bank atm shrogg: uhh dude TFK_Mickmoffat: but gonna have to waite untell monday shrogg: that mobo doseent support crossfire or sli TFK_Mickmoffat: untell i can buy it TFK_Mickmoffat: yes it dose shrogg: uhhh no it does not TFK_Mickmoffat: show me then shrogg: Expansion Slots 1 x PCI Express x16 slot, running at x16 (PCIEX16) 1 x PCI Express x16 slot, running at x4 (PCIEX4) 2 x PCI Express x1 slots (The PCIEX1_1 and PCIEX1_2 slots share bandwidth with the PCIEX4 slot.) (All PCI Express slots conform to the PCI Express 2.0 standard.) 3 x PCI slots shrogg: nothing there xD TFK_Mickmoffat: it supports it tho shrogg: how do you know that? TFK_Mickmoffat: because it has 2 gfx card slots shrogg: that dosent mean it does sli or crossfire shrogg: it has to have another inbuilt chip to do that shrogg: thats just supports 2 screens shrogg: it dosent link the graphics cards tho TFK_Mickmoffat: DDR3 1866 Cross Fire Support PCI-E shrogg: show me TFK_Mickmoffat: ill ask a qustion on the website about it shrogg: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview.asp?partid=8601 shrogg: that one actually says that it supports crossfire shrogg: # AMD AM3 Platform # Support latest AMD Phenom ™ Quad-Core Processor # Dual-Channel DDR3 # AMD Hybrid CrossFireX™ and DX10 Support # SidePort Memory Onboard # Quad-CrossFire Support # HDMI/DVI/RGB Support # Instant Internet Access with Express Gate shrogg: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview.asp?partid=13166 shrogg: same with that one TFK_Mickmoffat: crossfireX is crossfire with the inbuilt GPU and a external one shrogg: nope TFK_Mickmoffat: Support for ATI Hybrid CrossFireX technology shrogg: its crossfire with any 2-3 linked graphics cards shrogg: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview.asp?partid=12414 shrogg: even tho it has 4 slots for cards it still says crossfireX TFK_Mickmoffat: What Is ATI CrossFireX™ ATI CrossFireX™ is the ultimate multi-GPU performance gaming platform. Enabling game-dominating power, ATI CrossFireX technology enables two or more discrete graphics processors to work together to improve system performance. For The Ultimate Visual Experience™, be sure to select ATI CrossFireX ready motherboards for AMD and Intel® processors and multiple ATI Radeon™ HD graphics cards. ATI CrossFireX technology allows you to expand your system’s graphics capabilities. It allows you the ability to scale your system’s graphics horsepower as you need it, supporting up to four ATI Radeon™ HD graphics cards, making this the most scalable gaming platform ever. Combination Options Chart shrogg: yeah TFK_Mickmoffat: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview-specs.asp?partid=12659 then this one shrogg: its not with a onbord gpu, its with multible cards shrogg: I win this arguement xD TFK_Mickmoffat: kk im getting confused with the on wiht the onbord gpu TFK_Mickmoffat: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview-specs.asp?partid=12659 shrogg: LOL TFK_Mickmoffat: im getting that one shrogg: still no crossfire shrogg: thats a HYBRID mobo shrogg: hybrid means STAND ALONE shrogg: so it dosent link the graphics cards TFK_Mickmoffat: FFS shrogg: what kind of prosessor do you have? TFK_Mickmoffat: AMD phenom II x4 945 3.20ghz TFK_Mickmoffat: AM3 shrogg: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview.asp?partid=8601 shrogg: get that one then shrogg: it looks cool, is the same price and SUPPORTS crssfire shrogg: LOL TFK_Mickmoffat: lol TFK_Mickmoffat: i will ty shrogg: I WIN shrogg: and lol shrogg: posted this convo on the internet xD

item.title: LOL @ my friend
item.dc:creator: @Baros_Rocks Baros Rocks
item.description:
@Baros_Rocks wrote:

lol that’s so funny what a noob

item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

just read this, it was a aruement about what mobo he should buy, and he wanted a crossfire mobo, but the one he chose dident suppport it, so i attemped to point him in the rite direction xD

TFK_Mickmoffat: hey shrogg: hi TFK_Mickmoffat: what you up to?? shrogg: just about to get food shrogg: :P TFK_Mickmoffat: kk TFK_Mickmoffat: should i get $169 mb or $200 ram or got a $200 mb and $169 ram?? (All PCI Express slots conform to the PCI Express 2.0 standard.) 3 x PCI slots shrogg: nothing there xD TFK_Mickmoffat: it supports it tho shrogg: how do you know that? TFK_Mickmoffat: because it has 2 gfx card slots shrogg: that dosent mean it does sli or crossfire shrogg: it has to have another inbuilt chip to do that shrogg: thats just supports 2 screens shrogg: it dosent link the graphics cards tho TFK_Mickmoffat: DDR3 1866 Cross Fire Support PCI-E shrogg: show me TFK_Mickmoffat: ill ask a qustion on the website about it shrogg: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview.asp?partid=8601 shrogg: that one actually says that it supports crossfire shrogg: # AMD AM3 Platform # Support latest AMD Phenom ™ Quad-Core Processor # Dual-Channel DDR3 # AMD Hybrid CrossFireX™ and DX10 Support # SidePort Memory Onboard # Quad-CrossFire Support # HDMI/DVI/RGB Support # Instant Internet Access with Express Gate shrogg: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview.asp?partid=13166 shrogg: same with that one TFK_Mickmoffat: crossfireX is crossfire with the inbuilt GPU and a external one shrogg: nope TFK_Mickmoffat: Support for ATI Hybrid CrossFireX technology shrogg: its crossfire with any 2-3 linked graphics cards shrogg: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview.asp?partid=12414 shrogg: even tho it has 4 slots for cards it still says crossfireX TFK_Mickmoffat: What Is ATI CrossFireX™ ATI CrossFireX™ is the ultimate multi-GPU performance gaming platform. Enabling game-dominating power, ATI CrossFireX technology enables two or more discrete graphics processors to work together to improve system performance. For The Ultimate Visual Experience™, be sure to select ATI CrossFireX ready motherboards for AMD and Intel® processors and multiple ATI Radeon™ HD graphics cards.

ATI CrossFireX technology allows you to expand your system’s graphics capabilities. It allows you the ability to scale your system’s graphics horsepower as you need it, supporting up to four ATI Radeon™ HD graphics cards, making this the most scalable gaming platform ever. Combination Options Chart
shrogg: yeah
TFK_Mickmoffat: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview-specs.asp?partid=12659 then this one
shrogg: its not with a onbord gpu, its with multible cards
shrogg: I win this arguement xD
TFK_Mickmoffat: kk im getting confused with the on wiht the onbord gpu
TFK_Mickmoffat: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview-specs.asp?partid=12659
shrogg: LOL
TFK_Mickmoffat: im getting that one
shrogg: still no crossfire
shrogg: thats a HYBRID mobo
shrogg: hybrid means STAND ALONE
shrogg: so it dosent link the graphics cards
TFK_Mickmoffat: FFS
shrogg: what kind of prosessor do you have?
TFK_Mickmoffat: AMD phenom II x4 945 3.20ghz
TFK_Mickmoffat: AM3
shrogg: http://www.computerlounge.co.nz/components/componentview.asp?partid=8601
shrogg: get that one then
shrogg: it looks cool, is the same price and SUPPORTS crssfire
shrogg: LOL
TFK_Mickmoffat: lol
TFK_Mickmoffat: i will ty
shrogg: I WIN
shrogg: and lol
